item.title: When You Can’t Stop Working, Automate Saying “No”
item.description: When you're too tired to stop working, a brutal set of scripts can save you from yourself. MacOS, Python, and some shell magic.
item.dc:creator: wwakabobik

item.title: Supercharged Weather Station
item.description: A weather station with a Raspberry Pi, webserver and Arduino, LoRa SX1278 modules.
item.dc:creator: wwakabobik

item.title: Adding Tests to Vercel
item.description: Adding automated tests to your Vercel project can be quick and efficient. Here's a two-path guide to integrating tests using GitHub Actions or Vercel's Checks.
item.dc:creator: wwakabobik

item.title: Test classes - how to rerun them
item.description: Dealing with imperfect code and test environments can drive you crazy, especially when you need to properly rerun failed tests while preserving the state of the test environment. How I deal with it using pytest?
item.dc:creator: wwakabobik

item.title: The Resurgence of Retro Games: A Pixelated Renaissance or a Soul-Crushing Cash Grab?
item.description: Some argue that remasters are a necessary evil, allowing classic games to be enjoyed by a new generation of gamers. Others think that they are destroying the original game's charm and erasing the nostalgia that many players hold dear.
item.dc:creator: wwakabobik

item.title: TestRail Reporter
item.description: Reporting results from your automation tests to TestRail is a good idea. Especially for management with KPIs of automation coverage, and some other metrics. Let's automate it and report it to Testrail, Slack, email, etc.
item.dc:creator: wwakabobik

item.title: I hate API testing
item.description: Writing API tests is a boring and time-consuming task. Why we need to write tests manually and not use the same tools for testing as for development? Let's try to automate API testing using Swagger and few Python magic.
item.dc:creator: wwakabobik

item.title: Comparing 2023 LLMs
item.description: Which AI image generator is the best in 2023? Let's compare more than 20 models and services to find out.
item.dc:creator: wwakabobik

item.title: Generate images via API using AI
item.description: It's time to revisit AI image generators and use them from API. How to generate images via API using AI? Let's compare Leonardo.ai, DALL-E-3 and Midjourney.
item.dc:creator: wwakabobik

item.title: Horror games of 90s
item.description: Halloween is coming! Let's remember best chilling PC games of 90s. If you like horror games, you should definitely check out these classics!
item.dc:creator: wwakabobik

item.title: AI practices used for QA
item.description: Can AI completely replace human testers? Is it more than tool? What are the best practices for using AI in QA? Let's find out!
item.dc:creator: wwakabobik

item.title: My history of first-person view party-based RPG
item.description: I love first-person view party-based RPGs. Here is a list of games I played and my thoughts about them and future of the genre.
item.dc:creator: wwakabobik

item.title: Making AI chatbot to hear and speak
item.description: Learning to interact with chatbots in a natural way. How to make a bot speak and listen using Python
item.dc:creator: wwakabobik

item.title: AI image generators
item.description: Are there alternatives for Midjourney? Can they compete with it? I am doing my research on generative AI image tools and services.
item.dc:creator: wwakabobik

item.title: Road trip from Serbia to Montenegro
item.description: Impressions from a car trip on a seaside vacation from Serbia to Montenegro
item.dc:creator: wwakabobik

item.title: Can AI write a fairy tale?
item.description: Are AI ready to tell the stories? At least teenager fairy tale?
item.dc:creator: wwakabobik
